title: Man United could be RELEGATED if Solskjaer's miserable run continues, according to Sam Allardyce
text:
Manchester United could be relegated this season if Ole Gunnar Solskjaer cannot quickly turn their miserable run around, according to Sam Allardyce.

The former Bolton, Newcastle and England manager cited United's side in 1974 that, against all expectations, was relegated to the second tier.

With Solskjaer overseeing the club's worst start in 30 years, Allardyce has used the side from 45 years ago as a warning to the current crop that they are not too good to be relegated.

Manchester United could be relegated under Ole Gunnar Solskjaer, claims Sam Allardyce

The former Bolton, Newcastle and England boss is worried about United's lack of a goalscorer

Speaking on talkSPORT's Alan Brazil show, Allardyce said: 'It isn't beyond the realms of possibility that they could catastrophically fall into more problems if confidence goes and injuries stay like they are.

'Players tend not to get as fit as quick as they would do when things are going well, that's an absolute fact. There's the disturbance of [Paul] Pogba wanting away and who will pop up next saying, "I see this going the wrong way, I want to leave?"

'Manchester United do not have enough goals and you can see it becoming a struggle. Hopefully it's not a struggle down the bottom end, but they're certainly heading that way.'

Marcus Rashford has been tasked with scoring goals after Romelu Lukaku's summer departure

Since the 4-0 opening weekend rout of Chelsea at Old Trafford, Solskjaer's side have won just once and are now just two points above Everton in the relegation zone.

It took penalties for United to squeeze past League One Rochdale in the Carabao Cup while they were poor value in the Europa League with a 0-0 draw away to AZ Alkmaar.

Marcus Rashford has been handed the responsibility to deliver goals after Romelu Lukkau was sold to Inter Milan on deadline day and was not replaced, leaving a major hole in United's sparse attack.
